Reviews.Title: “Hotel Forum Roma”
Reviews.Author: DazmanIsBack
Reviews.Content: OK - ish. It's all about the location! The room was spacious (devoid of character.) I arrived late on a weekday and left the following morning so it's harsh to judge, however this place is all about the position. Breakfast is taken on a 5th floor restaurant overlooking the forum(s) of Rome's greatest leaders. A walk to the Colosseum is only 5 minutes so no complaints there. I can't comment on the food as I only took fruit at breakfast, but what I saw (not tasted) looked ok!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, clean rooms, genuine artifacts”
Reviews.Author: JilliMarie
Reviews.Content: It took us a few turns around Rome to find the Hotel Forum because it is literally right behind the Forum of Augustus... Once we arrived (9 of us) we were delighted to learn that our rooms were ready early. Each of our three rooms was charming and different. The front desk gentlemen were courteous and had keen senses of humor, which we enjoyed. The hotel is walking distance from the Colosseum, the Forum (wow!!!!), and about 10-20 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, SLEEPLESS nights :(”
Reviews.Author: familytrips123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is in walking distance to almost everything. The Colosseum is exactly where described in other reviews. Most of the staff we found helpful and polite. The "continental breakfast" selection is a bit lacking (canned fruits), cereal, and pastries. We did not eat on the roof for dinner. The rooms and decor were old fashioned, but the room was clean. We had a two bedroom/two bath which was much more roomy than anticipated. The beds and pillows were like bricks. Our room overlooked a picturesque alley way, however, there is an Irish pub that was right across from our room and it stayed noisy ALL night long till 3 a.m. or so. The customers of the pub were loud and obnoxious - talking, singing, smoking, ect. Our room was hot and stuffy in the evenings and the air conditioner was spitting out stale, mild air. The night air was crisp and wonderful, however, we couldn't open our windows at night because the smell of smoke from people standing on the outside of the pub. When the windows were closed it helped a tad bit but not enough to make a huge difference because the walls were really thin. We used our "white noise" and you could still hear the people talking. I would love to give this hotel a "very good" score, but I have to give them average due to the hard beds and sleepless nights due to the noise outside our window. We did get a great nights rest when we spent one evening in the Almafi Coast - that was paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: carriearrie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Forum for three nights and had a wonderful time. Upon arrival we left our baggage and wandered along to the Colosseum which took three minutes tops! So you can see how close the Hotel is to all the amazing attractions of Rome. We dined in the Rooftop Restaurant and had a great meal, the food and service were fabulous. The hotel was clean and pleasant with amazing views ( we had deluxe room with view), well worth the price. We were recommended the Hotel and would do the same to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “For the views alone. . .”
Reviews.Author: mel1002
Reviews.Content: It's hard to match the Forum for location if the ancient city, as opposed to St Peter's, is where you want to be. The room upgrades are worth paying for it seems and the hotel does very competitive rates off season with the additional incentive of a loyalty discount if you return! Whilst I'd echo the other comments regarding the prices in the bar and restaurant I can see how they're comparable with similar establishments. The view from the bar alone is worth pushing the boat out just once. With so very many excellent places to eat and drink nearby though it would be criminal not to sample what the rest of the city has to offer and yes your money does go further. If you want views that will live with you forever and especially if you're staying in Rome for just a few days and want to make the most of your time with a very central location and you feel like a real treat the Forum is hard to beat. The service and cleanliness and location were all superb.

Reviews.Title: “the views are worth your stay here”
Reviews.Author: alslyns
Reviews.Content: we had a great time at the hotel forum. bang in the centre its so easy to get around rome from here. the restaurant was lovely, the view from it was stunning at night, looks right onto the forum. the rooms were slightly old fashioned but that seems to be the style in italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room, we had no view & tiny shower.”
Reviews.Author: Kate A
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Rome last year, it was the first weekend in March 2011. We flew into Rome and caught the train from the airport into the city then the metro to the hotel which was fun and made a nice change from just jumping in a cab & being delivered. We arrived at the hotel and it had a 1930's feel. This is not a modern hotel but that is part of it's charm, the front of house staff were polite but reserved and the bar staff, we found were wonderful. They gave us great recommendations for places to eat. The first night we were tired so we ate in the hotel restaurant, my advice DO NOT EAT IN THE HOTEL RESTAURANT. It is over priced, the service was bad and they rushed us BUT the views at night are special. Within a short walk you can find great food & much cheaper. Our bedroom was small but clean, the same with the bathroom but we were in Rome to explore so for us it was a base to sleep & to change. My best tip is to catch the glass lifts to the top of the Vittoriano which is a 5-10min walk away. It had by far the best view of Rome and at only 7 Euro it was reasonable, it was empty when we went up and stayed there over an hour, we stumbled across this quite by chance as I hadn't read in any guide book that you could go to the top. The morning on top of the Vittoriano was my favorite day!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Forum Review”
Reviews.Author: Darren I
Reviews.Content: Super hotel in a prime location. Room out of this world with friendly hotel staff from the chambermaids to the manager on the front desk. The only downside was the prices in the bar and the restaurant. With so many quality, far cheaper options within walking distance the hotel could be losing good trade by pricing themselves out of contention. One small beer and a glass of wine in the hotel 17 Euros. In an Irish bar within 30m of the hotel, one large beer and a glass of mine 8 Euro. Do the maths!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonRobt
Reviews.Content: Great location for a short stay to explore all of the sights of Rome. Hotel is not too large, staff are friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed it and pricing was about right. Will return one day I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MammaRyan
Reviews.Content: lovely cosy comfortable little hotel in a wonderful location. Comfortable beds, small but perfectly formed bedroom and bathroom. More expensive than we would usually go for but we felt it was worth the extra expense for a treat. The staff were warm and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “idealy located”
Reviews.Author: cgg5072
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome so we chose the great located Forum Hotel. The hotels rooms are dated but clean with no english TV channels. The breakfast terrace is overlooking the Forum which is spectacular.Its a continental breakfast which was sufficient. The roof terrace bar also overlooks the Forum.Its expensive however.I dont think I'll ever get used to paying £6 for a coke or a small beer and £10 for a glass of prosseco. The hotel restaurant is very expensive and we never saw a diner in there during our stay. We found to great value restaurants with awesome food.If you turn left immediately after leaving the hotel you will find a great authentic Italian literally next to the hotel.A couple of hundred yards further on there is a good chinese restaurant were they sell a full bottle of Rose Mateus for £6.The food is also delicious and extremely good value. Other tips for Rome are: Dont let the taxi drivers quote you on a fair always use the metre as its cheaper. The guided tour for the Vatican and Colisseum are good value and you beat the queus. The restaurants near the main attractions are very expensive so move back a street or two for better value and quality. Dont get your pictures taken with the centurions at the Colisseum as they charge 20 euros and if you dont pay they get nasty, we saw a few people fall for this.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Forum - Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Sheena C
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a group booking at this hotel to attend a 2 day sales meeting. This traditional style hotel is fantastically located in the centre of Rome in easy walking distance of all the attractions. The staff were helpful, friendly and welcoming and the rooms spacious, clean and inviting. The rooftop restaurant offers an amazing view - breakfast is breathtaking! The meeting room was large and comfortable with integrated data projector and all equipment requested. The only negative comment received was the price of drinks in the bar - but you are in the centre of the Eternal City and hotel bar prices are expensive generally in this area. Would highly recommend and will definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “www.iVegas.com - visit's Rome”
Reviews.Author: Andrea H
Reviews.Content: In summer 2011 our company iVegas.com went on a business trip to Europe. We visited several cities in Italy, stayed in Rome, in a small historical hotel FORUM. This hotel is located in central Rome just a short walking distance from the Coliseum. The hotel is very small, but the staff is friendly and always available to help you and answer all your questions. Rooms are clean but very small especially the bathroom which is extremely small. All in all, our experience in most of the hotels were good , if you are planning to stay in Rome only for few days and don't mind small rooms, Hotel Forum could be a good option for you. iVegas.com

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Plujon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with my wife. The hotel is in a superb location with iconic views over the Forum and towards the Collisseum. It is within easy walking distance of all Rome's main attractions but off the main road so reasonably peaceful. Crown in the jewel is the restaurant on the top floor with one of the best views in Rome. Old world feel with wood panneling and leather chairs in reception. Unfortunately it is slightly run down, could do with some tlc whilst retaining its old world charm. Our room, whilst clean, was somewhat tatty and in need of cosmetic attention although everything worked OK. It is not cheap and I would expect better condition rooms at this price but that said the location and view from the restaurant make it just about worthwhile..

Reviews.Title: “Recent trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: juanitajane
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Traditional & stylish. Very helpful & professional staff. Great location. The only problem was the noisy emptying of bottle bins outside v early in the morning. We stayed at same time as new prime minister was there so had some interesting chats with waiting photographers in street outside. Short walk to nearest metro. Good bars & restaurants a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: maikel
Reviews.Content: the location cannot be beaten,but service should be improved.had to pay for eggs for breakfast,the orangejuice machine was taken away while breakfast was still underway.we would not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “View of the Forum from an antique filled hotel”
Reviews.Author: amombourquette
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a side street just off the Flor de Imperiale which means that you are seconds from the Roman Ruins and you have direct views of the Forum (and the Colosseum) from your room. The hotel is lovely polished old carved wood both in the public areas and the rooms. The rooms are a tad small but enough for the time you spend there! There is also a wonderful rooftop bar to enjoy further direct views and lovely sunsets. To top it off the hotel's rates are very competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: travellers-o-t
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of October for my 50th birthday and was disappointed to get a twin room at the back of hotel even though we paid for a upgrade before we left but we managed to get a double the next day.You are definitely paying for the location as the rooms are not 4star standard.The roof top bar has lovely views but very expensive.The breakfast is ok the usual croissant and coffee cold meats and cheese and sets you up for a day of sightseeing.We had a fantastic time in Rome but I don't know if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Right on Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Forum for 6 great days. The location, near the Colosseum and Palatine Hill, is superb, allowing walking even to the Vatican (40 minutes). Our room (#204), although a little older, was comfortable, clean, roomy, and sufficiently quiet. The bathroom was fully modern and sparkling clean. The view right out the window directly across to the Roman and Imperial fora was incomparable. Sipping Proseco on the rooftop bar at night is one of those "once-in-a-lifetime" experiences! The hotel management was very kind and helpful and the breakfast buffet was excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pam1997
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel on our first visit to Rome. The hotel was in the best location to see all the wonderful sites of Rome. Although the hotel is old and rooms were small it was clean, quiet and very comfortable. The restaurant on the roof was fantastic (one of the best meals we had on our whole trip) and also the rooftop bar had wonderful views of the ruins and terrific atmosphere. Would definitely stay there again if we are lucky enough to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: kim c
Reviews.Content: I am a retired, 72 year old, American who travelled recently to Italy. In October we stayed four nights at the Hotel Forum and one night at the Hotel Nerva. The two hotels are a few yards away. Both hotels have a great location, a helpful staff, comfortable European hotel rooms (smaller than most in the US at that price range) and are a reasonable value. Both were quiet, an important consideration for my wife and I, although that may not be true in the summer. The Nerva has been updated recently while the Forum may look dated to many from the US. Between the two I liked the Forum slightly better. Each morning we had a good, albeit cold, breakfast at the roof top restaurant. The view was superb and it was always a great way to start the day. I also liked the dated charm of the hotel. If you choose the Forum to stay you get a free drink at the rooftop bar, a great way to start a trip. However, if you order a drink you may be shocked at the price. I was there during the demonstrations but had few problems.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding supreme”
Reviews.Author: tenny500
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel restaurant for my wedding party. There were 20 of us and we were seated at a table amongst other diners. We were allowed to 'act' like it was our own restaurant though and have speeches throughout. The staff were brilliant, very efficient and friendly and we were delighted with the whole experience. We had been on the phone prior to booking the restaurant with the manager Rino and he was great. The views are spectacular and the rooftop bar is fantastic. All in all it was great and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “An old favorite disappoints...”
Reviews.Author: Wendy P
Reviews.Content: After having enjoyed 6 visits over 20 years and sending many friends to Hotel Forum, we experienced a stunning disappointment during our recent visit, on the weekend of the large demonstrations nearby. Specifically, we arrived at the hotel for a one night sentimental stay after walking with our luggage past police road blocks over 1 km, and finally arrived around 6pm. Accustomed to a warm, typically Italian greeting at this fondly remembered destination, we were stunned by the curtness and utter lack of welcome or appreciation by the sole staff member on duty. His heavy German accent belied his Tyrolean origins in Northern Italy. The details of our interaction with him were so disturbing to my wife, to whom he was notably rude, that I felt I had to go back downstairs afterward and speak to him: More curtness ("the demonstrations are NOT my fault!) and lack of understanding that all we expected was to be greeted with the type of civility and Italian graciousness that we had experienced all over Italy during many years of travel there. With such a start to our visit, we had far less tolerance for the odd lack of availability of an open, ever-ready bar, and the 8pm start time of dinner service in the rather mediocre dining room. On future visits to Rome we will certainly NOT be returning to the Hotel Forum, but rather, will return to the Hotel Hassler which has never, so far...., disappointed. We will return to Hotel Forum only in our scrapbooks. Ralph P.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with a dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Nenuphar A
Reviews.Content: Last week, we were staying at Hotel Forum for 2 nights. We were so exciting especially, the hotel is very close to the Colosseum and Foro Romana. The room decoration is old, but very clean. Unluckily, there was a disappointment. The day before we leave the hotel, we asked if the reception could help us to book a taxi to the airport. We were deal with the price (75 euros, because it's a van). Just when we were about to leave the hotel, the reception staff gave me an invoice (wrote in Italian), and said that I have to pay for the taxi accommodation, 12 euros in addition to the 75 euros. This additional charged was never mentioned before, and I never get this kind of charge in any hotels in other countries, also. I would more appreciate if the reception staff could inform us any charges, in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: cheerzeazyd
Reviews.Content: We opted for this hotel because we were under the impression from the website that you could use the roof top terrace throughout the day. This was not the case, breakfast time ( which was poor choice and quality) and evenings and only if you ate there.The room was nice enough and the staff friendly, but would go else where if we return to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Excells in Guest Relations”
Reviews.Author: decindio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Forum for 1 week. We did not speak Italian and the front desk staff helped us with everything - even getting the taxi driver to actually get out of the car and help us in the train station. The breakfast on the roof was wonderful, the waitstaff great. This was in walkingdistance of all the sites. We did not experience any "bedbugs" or aircondition problems. We were there from 9-1 - 9-9-2011. The rooms were all very clean! I would highly recommend this hotel, and wish I was still there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydcar
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Rome and once again we stayed at Hotel Forum. Not only is this hotel in the middle of ancient Rome close to all the antiquities and sights, but also comfortable and our room was close to luxurious with a big king bedroom and a very large marble bathroom with bath. We were able to open windows on both walls and look straight out onto the remains of the ancient Imperial Forum. I found the staff to be both helpful and friendly and could not do enough to fulfil any requests we asked of them. Breakfast is served in what must be one of the most beautiful restaurant views in all of Rome in the rooftop restaurant. Internet access is also available if needed. The hotel is close to both Cavour and Colosseo metros and the buses are close by. HIghly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and no air conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: gregorylupo
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! CONS: - Bug bites. I got bug bites at night in bed while sleeping. - No AC. The built-in air conditioning in the room does not work. I was given a fan. - Cold staff. It wasn't cultural and I wasn't rude - the staff just didn't care. - Small rooms. Very small rooms, even for a hotel in Rome. The hotel website said their rooms were “large and spacious.” - Run down. The hotel hasn't been updated in probably 50 years. - Street noise. Not a complaint, just be aware that it isn't quiet. I was on the top floor (4th floor) and could hear the traffic with the windows closed. PRO's: - Clean. The hotel and rooms appeared clean. - Rooftop bar. You don't have to stay here to go up to the rooftop bar and enjoy the views. - Good location. Close to the coliseum, but, there are there are better options 100 feet away on Via Cavour that are substantially less expensive, with air conditioning and larger rooms. I read the bad reviews, but booked the hotel anyway. Don't make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Rooftop Terrace, Snobby Staff, Expensive Food”
Reviews.Author: samiam2
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from our stay at the Hotel Forum on 9/15-9/17. This hotel is great if "location" is the most important attribute you are looking for. Forum is a 2 minute walk, colloseum about 15 min walk. The staff at the check in desk were quite "cold" and unfriendly - my husband & I both dreaded having to ask them questions due to the snobby feel they gave us. The roof garden is beautiful - be prepared to spend $18 EURO for a mojito- this is not the place to eat & drink if you are on a budget. The bartender gave us the same snobby feel as the front desk staff. Maria in the breakfast room is our sole shining star - she was warm, friendly and always had a smile! Breakfast was good and the coffee was delicious! The rooms are clean & the hotel and room decor has a "1970's/ victorian era" feel. We ended up staying at a different hotel on our way back from our cruise about 10 days later. Experiencing the difference, we would not ever stay at this hotel again -- simply because of the lack of "warmth" the staff exuded.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay thank you”
Reviews.Author: TrudyRKent
Reviews.Content: I would just like to send a huge thank you to all the staff at the Hotel Forum who made our stay last week so enjoyable, the room and views were amazing and the meal on the roof top resturant for my birthday was unforgetable. My husband, son and I were made to feel so welcome and that nothing was too much trouble. We stayed in the family suite and had 4 windows which all had the most wonderful views of the forum and the top of the colleseum, we went for my 40th birthday and had an amazing time. The fact that we had two rooms in one but with curtains to close off the rooms was a great idea when travelling with a child so that when he went to bed we could stay up and not disturb him, the room was lovely and clean and the windows and shutter blocked out the busy Rome traffic so was very peaceful. The staff were all helpful and could not do enough for us. We will definatly be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast on the roof terrace, overlooking the Forum!”
Reviews.Author: suntandrews
Reviews.Content: Interesting hotel. Fantastic location just by the Forum. Dining roof terrace makes the stay worthwhile. Rooms OK, not great. Staff a bit offhand. Getting there by car is a real adventure! Good food. The roof terrace will sell it to me every time!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: PiperPiper
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay in Rome for 4 days/3nights and wanted to make the most of our short time there. The Hotel Forum is so well placed for a whirlwind few days of discovery. It is also fairly level ground which also makes getting around much easier if there are those in your group that would not do well with steep hills and inclines. Our room readily accommodated 2 adults and one child. The room was very clean and was charming with its' decor. Yes the lobby is definitely dated, I am wondering if some updating may be in the works. Love the woodwork, but even a few smart leather couches to replace the saggy velvet furniture would not be out of place or detract from "old world charm". Breakfast on the rooftop, a pot of espresso and a pot of milk... Is there a better way to start the day? Then finish the day one flight of stairs higher up at the rooftop bar, watching the sun setting as you look over the ruins of the Forum or catch a glimpse of the Colosseum between the buildings. Walking distance to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, and of course the Forum and Colosseum. A quick taxi ride to the Vatican , Piazza Navona, and well located for public tansit as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad. Amazing and annoying!”
Reviews.Author: myyscreenname
Reviews.Content: The good stuff…. If you are going to Rome for vacation and a break then this hotel is perfect. The main positive of the hotel is the location, right in the middle of the Forum and five mins from The Coliseum. Be sure to spend the extra to get a room with a forum view, ideally a corner room. The view is absolutely stunning, one of a kind. The hotel is clean, friendly staff and a pleasant place to stay. There are however a number of things they need to improve on. If you are a business traveller and need to do your emails then this might not be the best choice. The wifi signal does not properly reach every room and you might need to go into the hallway or down to the lobby to get a useable signal. Awkward if you want to do your emails in the comfort of your own room. Admittedly, they did not charge because of the bad signal but all said, it was a big inconvenience to me as I needed to be online every day. For the high fee of 10 Euros a day they should not only have this together but also have a LAN connection available along with a useable table that one could place the laptop on, not an uneven old wooden cabinet without any power points anywhere nearby. For the cost of the hotel room this should really be free to guests anyway. Also, the wifi is only for ‘one device’. Again awkward because I ideally needed a signal on my iPhone and my computer. They also need to put new safes in the rooms. Our one was very old and did not work. However, they had a safe in their office as a back up. This had its own individual key. The other gripe is the breakfast. Apart from the fantastic coffee, there was little else besides cakes or cereal along with a very small offering of cheese and ham. The bread and croissants were made with a sweetened mixture and not anything like one would expect. This however seems normal for Rome bakeries and cafes. I would say though that as an ‘International’ hotel one needs to serve an ‘International’ breakfast which would include breads for all tastes. Also, bearing in mind the cost of the hotel it would be more civilised to not have all the hot food items with an additional surcharge. The rooms are expensive enough anyway. Air con was just about adequate but if you like super cold, then you will not get the temparature down enough. All that said, I would stay there again definitely. Stunning location and views. That is the main advantage of this hotel, along with the great restaurant round the corner called Massenzio. A little gem!!

Reviews.Title: “I will come back”
Reviews.Author: realconsole
Reviews.Content: Good hotel very close to Piazza di Spagna...I booked the room 2 months ago and I had 10% discount, because I paid cash....The only concern is that they promise a bottle of wine or oil as a present, but they didn't give me anything. Even if I asked why, they never replied

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place in great area”
Reviews.Author: JNBsopinion
Reviews.Content: Small but beautiful. Clean and would definitly go back. Nice Restaurant with great lunch. Try the antipasto. Front desk personal not very helpful. Walk to the Colisium.

Reviews.Title: “Great location from which to sightsee”
Reviews.Author: rosarylou
Reviews.Content: This hotel was probably once very grand, now seems to be slightly stuck in a time warp, however, the hotel was clean, the staff courteous and the breakfast was very good. Best of all the location was brilliant! Could have walked everywhere but did the open top bus and walked back from Vatican. We had a view of the Forum from our window. All in all I would recommend this for a weekend's sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel, anywhere, ever”
Reviews.Author: Graham M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least once a year since 2003. I am completely in love with the place .. and it has always occurred to me that forgiveness is an essential element of love. It saddens me that the starched linen bedside mats do not appear any more with the turndown service. It saddens me that the barman from the American Bar has finally retired (he wasn't THAT old, perhaps he'll be back next year). I notice that it gets more expensive at a pace well ahead of general prices, and the terms become tighter (100% up-front payment on booking for this May) and there is no longer fresh orange juice at breakfast. That's all a pity, and I see what other reviewers mean when they describe it as a location being milked by its owners. But you still eat breakfast looking down on the spot where Caesar was assassinated. You can throw a stone into Trajan's Markets. There is still nothing to compare with cocktails on the roof (even with a change of barman), looking past the tower of the neighbouring church to the floodlit Victor Emmanuel monument. Include a Sunday in your stay and you will breakfast to the peace of a traffic-free Via Dei Fori Imperiale. And the cool of the lobby, wifi at an antique writing desk, concierge in tails, it's all wonderful to return to after seeing the sights. I've more-or-less written the recent chapters of my own life story in terms of this hotel. I can't remember for sure, but I probably took my new wife to meet the Forum before I took her home to see my parents. We celebrated my first son's 18th here, and we will probably be back for his brother's in time. I brought my mother here when my Father died. I am so emotionally invested in the place that I am completely biased. So, I recommend you don't listen to me (and that way my favorite rooms won't be booked next time I go). :-)

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel with 4 star price”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our final hotel after visiting Venice and Florence. The first two hotels we stayed at were amazing, but the Hotel Forum was just an amazing let down. For the prices it charges and a 4 star rating we were expecting a certain minimum standard, but I fail to see how this hotel can still have a 4 star and falls below 3 star hotels I've stayed at. When we first arrived we were shown to a dark room at the back of the hotel which was awkward to get to. The porter noticed us looking at the two single beds and made a phone call to reception, which insisted it was us that had booked a twin room. My booking confirmation clearly stated double. Whilst we were waiting for a maid to push the beds together, we noticed the rest of the room. There was a large patch of black mould over a foot wide and 5 inches high on the wall by our bed. The rest of the walls were damaged with marks and the rugs in the room were covered in stains. The air conditioning unit was a separate unit below the window which barely did anything. We rang the company we had booked through to complain which seemed more concerned with defending the hotels rating then listening to what we were saying. They did say they would speak to the manager of the hotel and call us back. We were then informed that there was nothing that could be done as the hotel was full, but if we were still unhappy in the morning they would see about changing our rooms then. After telling them quite clearly we were not staying in a mouldy room, we were given two options, pay a cancellation charge of an unknown amount or look at other rooms which had magically become available. We decided to look at other rooms. We didn’t receive any apology and were sent the non-english speaking porter to show us the rooms. Eventually chose the only one with a double bed. Whilst at least clean it was still nowhere near a 4 star. The walls were still marked, the bed cover had black marks on it, the floor edging was missing in places, the bedside lights were hung like pictures with bear wiring in the back (only one worked) and the light switch by the bed could be pulled 1cm away from the wall. The room as with the rest of the hotel was lit with a very low wattage energy saving bulb which gave the room (as with the hotel) a very dinghy feel. The air conditioning unit was better, but had only an on or off mode. After deciding to try and make the most of our stay and just accept that we wouldn’t want to be in the hotel much, we began to change. At which point the porter walked back through the door with other guests showing them the room. Again we weren’t offered any apology for this. This left us feeling quite uncomfortable whenever we were there and led to us putting a chair in front of the door every time we were in there. Whilst there is no turn down service, this does not bother me in a hotel. The first full day of being in the hotel though, no one cleaned our room. We certainly saw the maids about, but I can only assume because we took an hour nap in the room at 2pm, this didn’t fit in with their own schedule and so didn’t bother coming back. The rest of the hotel is equally as worn and dinghy with no natural sunlight. The stairs are lined with a white fabric every day that by lunchtime are brown with dirt. I can assure you that the term “charming” used by some is just a polite way of saying tired and old. The restaurant does have a good view, which I can’t deny. The breakfast was okay, but simple and with no hot items. The staff are polite although it seemed to depend on what reception staff were on as to whether they would acknowledge you when you walked through the door. The location of this hotel is the only redeeming feature and I certainly would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda76Scotland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my parents stayed at the Forum for a week at the end of May. This was in fact the second time we have been to this hotel - the first time was in 2007. We found the hotel to be an ideal place to stay when visiting Rome. We had a nice twin room - with a single room and a double room and a bathroom in between. Both rooms were spotless clean - as was the whole hotel. The staff were very pleasant and spoke good English. The breakfast room was just great - on the roof with fab views of the city. The choice of food was good and there were loads of croissants and cakes to pick from. We did not eat in the restaurant so I can't comment on that. I think the best thing about this place is the location. It really is close to everything and easily within walking distance to all the main sights. The furthest thing was the Vatican - we got a taxi there but wallked back, so it is still not so far that you can't walk there. The only areas for improvement are the televisions - very small. We had two in our twin rooms - one was quite old fashioned, wall mounted and small. The other was modern but still small. It wasn't a big issue though - as we were not there to watch TV. We didn't use the internet so I can't comment on that service. The shower was tiny - if you were bigger than size zero then you would have struggled to manouevre. The nozzle was mounted above the bath - sideways instead of longways - so the water went right up against the shower curtain and left really no room to move. But apart from those small issues - we enjoyed our stay at the Forum and would certainly stay there again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Roma”
Reviews.Author: InessaZ
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved everything about this hotel with an exception of a few things. For one the staff is very friendly and they all say hello to you anytime they see you. The bar tended at the American Bar on the rooftop is fantastic and he made one hell of a sidecar for me that I will never forget. The two exceptions are that it is difficult for a taxi to get to this hotel because of it's location on such a small street corner and the other is that the beds were not veen pulled together so we continued to get stuck in a giant crack as the beds would separate throughout the night. They gave us a great room but with the two twin beds situated separately did not make for the best sleep. But the fact that we had a room with our own patio was really nice. I would highly recommend this hotel if you have the funds to stay here and you want to be close to the Forum, the Colosseum and Piazza Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location for this old cash cow”
Reviews.Author: Tripmom44
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. It was expensive, and we paid handsomely for the location and the view from the breakfast terrace. The hotel was tired and not user friendly. They are clearly cashing in on their location and on the business travelers. Room was adequate, but we had to go up an extra flight of stairs to go back down a flight of stairs to get to the back part of the hotel and our room. No view and a noisy patio beneath our rooms. The AC barely worked. Wifi was extra. Breakfast was adequate. The drinks at the restaurant bar were outrageously priced at 10 euros for a glass of wine or a beer. The staff was very snooty and catered to their business clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but needs a major facelift...”
Reviews.Author: MandarinOFan
Reviews.Content: This used to be one of my favorite hotels in Rome..., 25 years ago. The location can still hardly be beaten, right across from the Forum. The roof terrace restaurant, where breakfast is served, provides one of the best views of the city. And it is within reasonable walking distance (a leisurely 20-30 min) of other major attractions and shopping, such as Via del Corso, Piazza di Spagna, Fontana di Trevi, Piazza Navona, and surrounding areas. But..., both the rooms and the facilities (although they give you an internet access code, access is virtually impossible, worse than dial-up) need a major upgrade. Most of the employees are very nice and friendly; they seem to be aware of the hotel shortcomings and try to make up for them. But until the facelift happens, my advice is to go look elsewhere. really not worth the price until then.

Reviews.Title: “Last stop on honeymoon... mixed reactions”
Reviews.Author: jkcg
Reviews.Content: Our last stop on our European honeymoon was Rome. Hotel Forum was the most expensive hotel we had reserved on our whole trip, and we expected great things. Our first reaction when we arrived to our room was disappointment.... but it got better. The reason for the high price we soon discovered was the LOCATION. The location was awesome... right across from the Forum, and down the street from the Colosseum, which we walked by every day. The hotel itself seemed older... like an elegant hotel when it first opened, but appeared to need some updates. The room was relatively small and kind of blah. The breakfast, which was served on the hotel roof, was awesome!!! The view along with the fresh squeezed juice machine was great every morning. The service was mixed. The first person we dealt with seemed pretty drab, but we eventually found someone at the concierge who was awesome. He recommended a few restaurants, did some research for us on tattoo shops, and arranged for transportation to the airport. Wish I could remember his name, but we did leave him a tip, as he really helped make our experience at Hotel Forum a pleasant one. Not sure if we would stay here again... probably would do some price comparisons... but not sure if we could beat the location, breakfast, and front desk help. Those factors outweighed our disappointment in the room itself, and helped us decide to give this hotel a rating of Very Good.

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre hotel with mediocre service, but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: robtk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early july. We picked the hotel based on it's location and the reviews op TripAdvisor. To summarize our experience: perfect location, but poor hotel. The room was small and still has the furnishing from the day it opened, a zillion years ago. Bed was good however, and the room was clean. Hey that was all we needed, since we spent all our time sightseeing. But why a tv set with a screen smaller them my iPad? Just remove it all together . One thing that bugged me was the following: when we made the reservation we asked for a quiet room. During the checking, the man at the reception said: : You wanted a quiet room, right? I have one for you!". But I wonder what he means with quiet? We had room 413, right beneath the restaurant. There were many loud noises (tables, chairs moving, piano playing, etc. till late). That's not what I call a quiet room. We didn't have dinner in the restaurant, so I can't comment on that. I did look at the menu however, and the prices were so incredibly high we didn't even think about eating there. Same is true for the roof bar ("American Bar").: 6 euros for a soda???? Imagine beer, rum, wine, etc... The view from the bar and the restaurant is amazing tough! You can see the colloseum, the forum romanum, etc. These sights are across the street. Breakfast was very limited and certainly not what I expected from this 4* hotel. Quality ok, choice not. The hotel is old and it shows. So are the concierge and the men at the reception. The thing is: they are very friendly, but the are really no help. I asked several times for directions. And every time the same thing: ".that's difficult to explain, but why don't you take a taxi, is easy and cheap". Or they give simply incorrect information. But what bugged me most was this: the day before we checked out I asked if we could have a late checkout, or use a room for 15 minutes to change clothes and take a quick shower (our flight was at 8pm, and after walking around the entire day it is nice to freshen up. The response: "Of course, no problem. Just ask me again tomorrow when you check out, so I can keep a room, because we are very busy." But the next morning the story was: "yes we have a room for you, let me see.....hmmm... will be hard to have it cleaned...hmmm... oh sorry we're fully booked, but just drop by when you pick up your luggage, and we'll be able to help you". But when we got back we found our luggage just hanging around the lobby and there was no room, etc. It all added to our opinion that the friendliness is all fake. Which leaves me with a major plus for the hotel: Location, location, location! The hotel is next to the colloseum, the Forum Romanum, Piazza Venezzia is 3 minutes walk. Pantheon and Trevi fountain is abouy 15-20 minutes walk, etc. There are many buses and a metro stop within a few hundred yards that take you everywhere else in town. The location can't be beat! Would we go back? Probably not. Didn't like the mentality and the state of this old hotel (certainly considering the price we paid!)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SarahChris7179
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time finding a decent hotel with a room available for our stay in Rome and we finally found the Hotel Forum which looked nice and had actually come recommended. great location, right next to and overlooking the ruins of the Forum. We like an old fashioned style hotel and understand that furniture is old and has character. This hotel certainly had the old world Italian charm. There are no excuses for not being able to keep a hotel room immaculately clean. It was not a cheap hotel so there was a certain standard we expected. On arrival they couldn't find our booking although we had dealt with the manager directly via email. We were taken to our room by a very nice porter, which had no view like the website showed and there were two single beds for my husband and I. Never mind, we thought turn down staff would just push them together. No turn down at all which is strange when a bed is made up with a day cover/ bed spread. These things I could live with but what made us check out after one night was the hair on the bathroom floor and the toothbrush that was in the bottom of the toilet. This made us wonder if the bathroom had been cleaned at all since the last guest. On top of that the air-conditioning either was not working or extremely inefficient and we had a very restless sleep, the safe had been obviously tampered with and broken and the windows were not able to be locked. They did offer a complimentary 24 wifi password but the Internet was so slow it wasted much more time than it was worth. Breakfast was nice and on the roof top terrace. When we checked out afterwards, not one question was asked as to why we were leaving early and to be honest the guy on reception truly didn't appear to care. If it had been at a price more like €110 a night we may have forgiven some issues but sadly never the cleanliness. Luckily we got a room at a much nicer hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent restaurant with great service”
Reviews.Author: Lilind
Reviews.Content: Never stayed at hotel , but if it is as nice as the restaurant on it top roof then I won't be disappointed. Restaurant has some excellent view over the ancient rome, opposite the Roman Forum , just behind the Forum Nerva and perfect view of Coloseum. 5 starts just for that ! The get to the restaurant you need to pass through hotel lobby proceed till the end and then take the very small elevators located on left hand side to the top floor. Traditional Italian cuisine, nothing very special about the food, pastas and dolce, but the atmosphere, fantastic service and the view is breathtaking Definitely recommended and surely will try togo back there at later occasion with family

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant with fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: nutwood
Reviews.Content: We booked a lunch here as it was recommended as a restaurant with a view. The food was good, and the service was impeccable, the staff were great and really friendly. It was expensive but it was a great way to spend our first lunch in Rome. The hotel looked really nice too and hopefully we will stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Entering ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cathy_Zoltan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those who - travel by anything but car - like old style rooms and do not like design hotels - find consuming a good breakfast at a spectacular roof terrace delightful The staff was really helpful, the furniture in the hall is pleasant. While the whole hotel area is well-furnished, everything has the scent of old times. Breakfast was more than satisfactory. The housekeeping commando was absolutely appreciative to the leisure travellers like us - they didn't bother us when we took a rest in the afternoon, due to our long walks at the Rome nights.

Reviews.Title: “everything was fine but internet...”
Reviews.Author: applepei
Reviews.Content: I had my trip booked in the last mins and read several hotel reviews before I book it. I thought Hotel Forum is in the central location where has good view in the roof. Everything was fine and they told me the hotel building since 6th century which is nice. I have ready single room was very small but compared with hotel rooms in Manhattan, it's not bad at all. The only thing is single rooms are in the back side of the building which face a local bar where has a lot of people drinking at night which was a bit noisy especially during weekend. Staff here are very friendly, doesn't matter the in front desk, room cleaning or restaurant. They all very helpful. PS: The restaurant in this hotel is very expensive. About the location, it looks like central but you need to walk to wherever 10-20 mins. if that's a good weather which is fine. The only place you are close is colosseum. Although this area is less touristy in the back side if you like to keep little distance with tourists. The only thing I was not able to take it was the internet service in this hotel was very very bad. They gave you the password for 24 hr use and it could be useful for 5 mins or not useable at all. The staff was always trying to help or offer their computer but it was just very frustrated. If you are on a business trip or you need to work a little during your trip, you may seriously consider about this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Lucia04162011
Reviews.Content: We loved our Suite at the Hotel Forum. It was expensive, but well worth it once we got there. It was clean, Marco, who's been there since 1998 is very nice, and the jacuzzi tub is wonderful. Our Suite overlooked the Forum; my second most favorite place in the world. I was in heaven here. Loved it! My husband liked the food, but no American breakfast. The shopping directly around the hotel is very touristie. You can take the Metropolitana Linea B - Laurentina, to the third stop from Roma Termini, (1. Termini, 2, Cavour, 3. Coloseo) and get off at Coloseo. Turn right out of the uscita (exit) and walk down Via Imperiale until you get to Cavour, about three blocks or so. You'll know your're at Cavour when you get to the stop lights and the ticket booth to enter the Forum is right there too; it will be across the street on your left. Cross over Cavour and walk up Cavour...this is the weird and challenging part...Ok, there is a very narrow side street right at the beginning of Cavour probably 100 meters after the stops lights on the left. There are two pizzarias beside the side street. Turn left on the side street, you are now staring at the Hotel Forum in front of you. Walk on the side walk on the right, NOT ON THE STREET ITSELF because the cars are insane coming up that street. Literally, the hotel is right there in front of you. You cannot miss it. You are literally going to run straight into it. Its like a yellowish/orangish color building. I could see the very, very top of the coloseo from our room. Loved it. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Close to Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: BLT1991
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay close to ancient Rome, this is a great choice. We stayed here for 2 nights with a family of 4 (2 teenagers). This was the only hotel that we stayed in which actually had 2 bathrooms. The rooms were austere, but comfortable. There was no air conditioning…which was fine in April…I don’t know what August would be like in there. The breakfast terrace was amazing…overlooking the Forum. They also had a rooftop bar; however, the drink prices were “through the roof”…no pun intended. I’m all about “when in Rome” and dropping some coin, but the drink prices were crazy high. I found the hotel staff cordial, but not overly helpful. We had a luggage problem (not unloaded from the plane due to a worker strike…welcome to Italy). The hotel staff could have excelled in helping me get my bags…they said they were helping, but I really didn’t get that sense and had to go back to get the bags myself from the airport. I ended up incurring a $75 phone bill in the process for calls made from the front desk…I thought the hotel was covering the calls…it all seemed a little slick.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lethhaly25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with 2 adults and one child. Pros - The staff were great and spoke good english. The hotel was charming and the breakfast was great. We did not have dinner here but the view from there is fantasic. Plenty of other food choices in close proximty as well. The location is perfect for most of Roma's sights, but a cab or public transport would be required for the Vatican. It is also within walking distance of the central station but too far if have large luggage. The shopping nearby is also quite good, between the hotel and central station. Cons - We were in the part that needed a lift up, a walk along and then down another lift to get to our room. Yes it is pokey and strangely set out but we did not find it a problem. We had a connecting room (two rooms with a common entry and bathroom) which meant we had plenty of space but a sinlge room might be a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully decorated and friendly hotel with a mixture of below-average single rooms and more ideal double rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Romewriter_11
Reviews.Content: This is a centrally-located, friendly hotel with superb antique decor. On the whole, reception staff were very friendly and multi-lingual. It is a noisy, central location which in my opinion is not ideal for families with very young children. Also, the single rooms at the back of the hotel on fourth floor were below average in terms of size, view, ventilation and equipment,i.e. looked out on a huge ventilation shaft; tiny wardrobe.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location & wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Christine_Edwards99
Reviews.Content: I spent 27 nights at the Hotel Forum, and could not have been happier. The place is beautiful. It was once a convent; I would be happy to be a nun if I could live there! The 'continental breakfast' is a feast served on the top floor, with a panoramic view of the Forum, the coliseum, the palatine hill, and Victor Emmanuel II. The best thing about the place is the staff, particularly the concierges-- Giacomo (sp?) and Roberto-- and the food servers Anna and Maria. But all the staff were so helpful and kind. I've never traveled alone, but the people at the Forum Hotel made me feel as if I were not alone at all.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in center of old town”
Reviews.Author: frankie14_11
Reviews.Content: Decided to visit Rome with husband for long week-end.Flew from edinburgh early morning,was met by taxi drivers touting for fares 55euro.bus outside airport into city center 8euro each great.Hotel Forum very good old fashioned,lovely breakfast room overlooking Rome.Bedroom perfect,5 -10min walk to colosseum what a place Magnifico.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Summer09Heathrow
Reviews.Content: I checked the reviews before going on my trip. Metro stop is only 5 mins away. I had a fab time in Rome. The hotel was good. Breakfast was satisfying. Cleanliness good. Room service everyday. The only drawback was internet which we paid for but could not access in our room. It was accessible only in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Richie010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and really liked it. It is a very old fashioned hotel in style and demeanour but has gravitas and takes you back to a bygone age. It was recommended to me by Italian colleagues. Yes rooms are small and the lifts tiny but the location is brilliant for the Forum, my room had a view of it and the roof restaurant has an amazing view and serves great food. The coliseum is a 5 min walk, I walked it so I know. I had no problems with wifi in my room and the room was quiet. Overall a great hotel and a world away from the big chain hotels if that is what you like.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: SandyBostonMA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on a recommendation from a friend. It was perfectly located, which after an exhausting day sightseeing, we very much appreciated. It is one street over from the Forum/Coliseum. But, it was not what we would expect from a hotel who originally had rooms priced over 200Eu/night (which is not what we ended up paying). Pros: Location, location, location - really can't be beat. The staff was friendly/helpful. They had a shuttle service to the airport for 50Eu (which is cheaper than what we would have paid via taxi). Breakfast, which was included, had a decent assortment of pastries, cereal, etc. There is a beautiful rooftop restaurant that is perfect for starting the day in Rome. Cons: The Bathroom did not smell good (think nursing home smell). The room was very antiquated...right down to the chair that was stained and looked like it was from the 50's. The tv was definitely from the 70s/early 80s...a tiny 13-inch tv with very little to choose from for channels. The controls for AC/heat did not work. It was somewhat loud, but that's what you get for being so close to the action. My husband and I live in a city now, so it didn't bother us as much. We did not eat at the restaurant at night as the prices were outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but but very unreliable internet and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: VtDub
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 4 night stay while in town for business, but ended up staying for only 1 night. The hotel may be fine for leisure travel, but not suitable for working, or staying long periods in the room. The check-in process was fine, and staff seemed pretty friendly. I was given a voucher for a welcome drink. However, I was told that I arrived too late at night (8 pm) to actually use the voucher. The room itself is very small, and the decor is pretty old fashioned, though some may consider it rustic Italian charm. I would personally leave this type of historic building with character for sightseeing only, and be able to retire to a calm oasis with modern amenities. Cleanliness seemed decent, but be on the look out for insects that may fly into your room from the window. The window was open when I first got in. The bathroom is also small - I am a slim female, and had issues with my elbows knocking on the shower knob while shampooing.. unintentionally giving myself a cold shower. I don't know how an average sized guy would be able to manage it. The location is probably the best thing about this hotel. It's a close walk to the Colosseum and lots of shopping. Also, being right across from the Forum, it presents pretty views from the breakfast room. Breakfast itself was an unimpressive spread, but the croissants were definitely delicious. You can order hot items for an extra fee, but the normal items include cereals and pastries, and 1 variety of cheese and cold meat. The #1 reason why I decided to switch hotels was due to the poor internet connection. The primary reason for my trip was business, requiring a constantly reliable internet connection. Although the staff gave me the unexpected perk of 48 hours access to the wifi for free (they normally charge for it), it was almost unusable, and I'd have been even more upset if I had to pay for it. They did try to accommodate my concern by suggesting I wait until there was less guest traffic on the system, and offering access to the front desk's hard wire line, but that wouldn't work for my case. The desk and chair in the room are also not suitable for working.

Reviews.Title: “Matchless location, wonderful 1930's ambience and service”
Reviews.Author: HarryHSheffield
Reviews.Content: Location is simply the best for ancient Rome. Rooms and restaurant look out over the forums and it is a 200 yard walk to the Colosseum. Doesn't look much from the outside but inside - wow! Lovely interior - very 1930's rich wood, comfortable leather seating, pleasant bar. You half expected Hercule Poirot to appear. Service to match. Room very spacious and comfortable bed. Bath on the small side. Only gripe with the room - no facility to make a hot drink. Restaurant - very classy and located with the best views in Rome. Food also excellent. The problem is they know this and charge far far too much for dinner. Typical prices for a starter are around 25 euros with similar for sweets and mains over 30. Perhaps linked to this - it was virtually empty with few hotel residents there. Great for breakfast though. Shame really - if they made the prices even moderately more realistic it would be full. Of course in Rome finding somewhere else to eat is easy so a disappointment rather than a real minus. Overall - excellent and would choose the same again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mariagarcia17
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forum is a great value hotel particularly for families traveling together. Their family room has 2 separate rooms, a small anteroom, 1 separate toilet and 1 toilet and bath. It is a little quaint with comfortable beds. It might get a little noisy at night though if you open the windows because it is adjacent to a bar. Housekeeping cleans the room daily and replenishes toiletries accordingly. They have a very helpful Concierge Service, especially Massimo, who kindly assisted us with all our travel queries. Continental Breakfast is served daily from 7-10:30 a.m. with option for scrambled eggs et al for an extra fee. The elevators though are really small - good for 4 persons but you can always opt to take the stairs. Location is excellent and the view at the restaurant is to die for. They say that the best way to explore Rome is by foot but if you hate a lot of walking, you may opt for a private your. Ask Massimo for Mauricio - he is a very good tour guide and is worth every Euro. He has a nice, clean, spacious van with a smooth drive. The only thing we were disappointed about was the hotel's exclusive endorsement of Vastours to explore the rest of Rome/Italy. We booked with them twice and on both occasions, they failed to meet our expectations. First, the driver dropped us off in the middle of the city on our second day in Rome. We got lost and had a hard time getting a cab to get us back into the hotel. Massimo complained to Vastours on our behalf and got us a 10% discount for our next tour to Naples Capri AnaCapri and guess what? Vastours cancelled out last minute halfway through the trip because they waited for late passengers and the bus had problems with the aircon's whatever. Otherwise, Hotel Forum is a great place to stay, especially if you have children and want to stay together.

Reviews.Title: “Most accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: zenu
Reviews.Content: On arrival we requested a room with a view and this was arranged with little fuss. The hotel is in a great location (walking distance of the Forum/Palatino/Colosseum) and the views are stunning. Exceptionally clean in all areas. Welcoming and pleasant staff at all levels. Particular thanks to Maria, Anna, Ariel and Dante.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: aristonoia
Reviews.Content: We've been guested at the Forum Hotel for 1 night in July 2010. Perfectly located to visit the town. The Room was very nicely furnished, good facilities, just the TV was "very old standard" in our room. Abundant breakfast served in the restaurant area with view on the fori romani. The staff was very nice and helpful. They invited us for a free aperitivo at the bar located over the restaurant on a little balcony. We also had dinner at their restaurant, good food but a bit overpriced in my opinion, I guess you pay more for the very careful service they give you there. Overall a really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful food and views.”
Reviews.Author: Pengimo
Reviews.Content: Went for lunch at the restaurant here, wasn't staying in the hotel and found the service to be extremely good. The food was excellent, simple but delicious. The staff were very friendly and attentive. Would definitely recommend it and if you get a chance, go up onto the roof terrace to look out over the ruins - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: pmpearson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Forum at the recommendation of friends and couldn't be happier with our choice. The property is great, but the location is its best aspect. It is only a block from the Forum (hence the name) and you can see the ruins from the property. The rooms were comfortable and modern, and the hotel has a free computer downstairs (we had to pay for wi-fi, which we didn't like, and the connection wasn't good even when we paid). Other than the location, the best feature was the beautiful roof-top restaurant, where we had breakfast every morning and dinner and drinks on several evenings. The views are incomparable and spectacular and the staff attentive and charming. The concierge made good restaurant recommendations and helped on other things as this was our first stop in Italy and we didn't always know how to get around. Especially for those who love ancient Rome, there is no better location.

Reviews.Title: “elegant and classy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jonv07
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel which oozes class and fantastic views of the forum. Very friendly staff and great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny!”
Reviews.Author: tinoose
Reviews.Content: Perfect location with a very friendly staff. Pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Location Unmatched”
Reviews.Author: PPAinsworth
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Within, there are photos displayed of Bridgette Bardot in residence, taken at the peak of her fame and the hotel reflects some of that old style "Dolce Vita" elegance. Our room, 307, had side views of the Forum and the area being excavated adjacent to The Trajan Markets. It had two fully opening windows to let the sounds and sunlight of the city flood in, but also had internal shutters which blocked out any vestige of light and noise , if required, allowing extended sleep in the morning. The décor and room facilities were perfectly adequate and similar to other hotels of equivalent standard I've stayed at in Rome. Breakfast was normal continental, with a cooked option (albeit at a considerable cost). The top floor restaurant was a joy, with great views over the Vittorio Emanuel Monument and Forum. Likewise the rooftop bar, which seemed to open around 7.30 pm. The restaurant's evening menu was very highly regarded amongst local patrons and was priced accordingly. There are lots of street restaurants around the hotel, in all directions, but we stuck mainly with Angelino's across the road in the direction of The Colosseum. The food and ambiance were very good and prices as reasonable as you could expect in Rome, especially in that area. Incidentally, we also eat in Trastevere and it wasn't a lot different to anywhere else in terms of value. I've read previously about vagrants parking their beds outside the Hotel approaches and that still applied in August 2010. There's not a lot the Hotel can do about it as they are on public roads, but if you are offended by it , you are going to have to bypass quite a lot of the sites around Rome, because there are plenty of them about, it's just a sad fact of life in major European cities these days. To sum up, you will be hard pressed to find a better hotel location than this one in Rome and it also has a bit more to it's advantage than position alone, so it's a thumbs up from me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Blebton-Honings
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to the Roman Forum, Trajan's Market and 2 minutes from the Colosseum and the Vittorio Emanuele II Monument, which makes it an exceptional location to explore Rome from. There is a Metro station near by and the square outside the Vittorio Emanuele II Monument is a main bus hub - great! There are some reasonably priced restaurants and pizzerias nearby as well meaning you don't have to walk far for a good evening meal. The hotel itself has an old feel about it since it is decorated with old, dark wooden furniture with tapestry chairs and curtains. It has a slightly musty feel to it and is reminiscent of an old grand hotel or stately home. The room we had was quite small with no view and reached by the odd 2-lift arrangement that other reviewers have commented on, but my son and I found it easy to navigate the hotel and the room was great for our needs. The staff at the hotel were very helpful (as long as you take account of the brooding machismo that seems to be the norm for all Italian men!) and always happy to help or give directions to local sights or restaurants. The restaurant for breakfast was excellent - the views of Rome are magnificant as you drink your morning coffee - and the staff serving were very considerate. he breakfast offering was cereals, fruit, pastries and coffee and this was all fresh and delicious. We also visited the rooftop bar one evening and this is also excellent. Plenty of 2-seater settees with ered velvent and nothing but tea lights to illuminate the area so that the evening view of the forum and the Vittorio Emanuele II Monument are unspoilt. All in all I would say this was a very pleasant hotel with good staff and in absolutely fantastic location and would be happy to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: Tobyt777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Forum for a long weekend after booking through Expedia. The hotel was exactly what we had expected after reading reviews from TripAdvisor. It is excellently placed for all the big attractions - only five minutes to the Colosseum and about ten minutes back into the city for the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Piazza Navona etc..... The furthest walk is the Vatican, but still only about 20 minutes away. The room we had was a tad small, but as we were literally only sleeping here, and out all day, it didn't make any difference to our stay - it was clean and comfortable, which on any visitor to Rome, is all it requires to be. Only gripe is the bar and restaurant prices - exceptionally high even by Rome standard's, but the location of the roof restaurant and bar terrace are second to none. We allowed ourselves one drink an evening on the Terrace Bar, which everyone should do at least once when staying here (if only to be served by Paulo - very polite, friendly and courteous), before heading to the Piazza's for the evening. Some people have commented about issues with the free welcome drink the hotel give you - we had no problems with this. The staff were very friendly overall, allowing us to check in early (early flight), and hold our luggage after check-out (late flight) until we were ready to make our way to the airport. I would recommend the Hotel Forum to anyone visiting Rome, and in particular having a drink with Paulo on the Roof Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: TRIPLEGGG
Reviews.Content: The Forum Hotel is situated approximately 300m from the Coloseum and opposite the Roman Forum. A great location for any sightseeing tour with all the major attraction within walking distance. I found the staff very helpful and level of service very good. Breakfast was of a good quality and the views from both the restaurant and the `American Bar` only added to the experience.The heavy wood panneling and air conditioning make the lounge a comfortable place to relax and read a paper after a hard days sightseeing. Good restaurants and the Irish bar `Finnegans` only a short distance away. The only negatives and I`m struggling to find any were the noise in the morning from comuter traffic, solved by closing the window!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: mparry1964
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel to celebrate my wifes 40th birthday,so I wanted something with great views of the eternal city with a relax atmosphere etc. Well the hotel ticked all the right boxes with the views worth their weight in gold. The staff are very helpful and friendly, especially the barman who runs the American bar on the roof, there is not enough he could do for us and makes a great strawberry daiquiri. The breakfast is perfect for those hot summer months in Rome with a huge choice of options. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and with the forum a few yards away and the Colesseo about 500 yards away it is in the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff great location but wouldnt recommend”
Reviews.Author: Wozza62
Reviews.Content: I found the staff very friendly and helpful and the location great but little things let this hotel down badly. The internet connection was crawling when it actually worked and you could only watch about 3 of the 20 channels on the TV because of poor reception. For the room cost I expect better than 2 single beds shoved together to make a double and no coffee or tea making facilities in the room. And homeless people living practically outside the front door doesn't add to the ambience. Like I said little things that could have made the stay more enjoyable, I won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: bfeltus
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with the hotel. The "view" from our room was mostly garbage and a homeless community. Also our pillows were extremely lumpy which I would assume they were 20 years old 0 gross! All for the price of $300 per night! I would never recommend this hotel... yes, it's close to the Colisseum but quite a distance from everywhere else. And before "management" comments, we DID bring our concerns up to the manager but nothing was done. We basically had to "live" with it and pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: marcus094
Reviews.Content: i really enjoyed staying at the forum. the rooms were excellant, the staff were very friendy.especially the nice lady we got to know in the resturant. the rooms were clean and comfy, the concierge were very nice, and very helpful. the location was perfect for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NBC-NYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Forum for eight nights, mixing a few days of sightseeing with attending a meeting in Rome. The location across from the Forum is very picturesque and makes the hotel seem special The public areas of the hotel are quite nice, and the breakfast is served on a high floor overlooking the Forum. The rooftop bar (which also serves espresso, etc.) is wonderful. I made the mistake, however, of getting a single on the Internet special rate. This gave me a very small room that faced a dark, interior space, so that I could not tell the weather, and could barely tell day from night. It would have been worth spending more to get an exterior view. The one big negative is the wifi service. At best, it was very bad, with low signal strength and with extremely narrow bandwidth, with the result that it was almost always painfully slow. Moreover, the service went out entirely once and was not started again until the next morning. The staff (all of whom are very nice) do not seem to realize that, for many, a good Internet connection is an essential rather than an extra.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: andrewh
Reviews.Content: This is a long overdo review, as I have stayed at the Hotel Forum on numerous occasions. Simply put I love the Hotel Forum and all it's old world charm. I begin and end all my Italian trips at this hotel and consider it my home in Rome. I've never had a noisy, dirty, too hot nor cold room. It is always just perfection!!! What really sets this hotel apart is the loyal staff, they make this property shine. It reminds me of a time in the US when the service industry was a good career and an art form. The front desk, the restaurant and the amazing bar, all cater to your every need. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: willgmac
Reviews.Content: No air conditioning (they turned it off in the entire hotel "because of the economy") Internet connection is slow and unstable A total rip-off considering the amount of money we paid

Reviews.Title: “Always a joy to return to”
Reviews.Author: Sazd
Reviews.Content: It is always a pleasure to stay at the Forum - Friendly attentive staff, nothing too much trouble. Lovely accommodation and breakfast in the roof restaurant the perfect start to the day. I would not consider staying anywhere else - absolute perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Top views, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Girl76
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome with my now fiancé and we stayed at the Hotel Forum - it's right in the middle of Rome - a few minutes from the Colosseum and the metro. Walk up the cobbled street from the hotel and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from as well... Staff were friendly too! Drinks in were a little pricey to sit in the hotel but not far to go from the hotel if you do want a drink. All spoke English but a little Italian goes a long way and is appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: flyingbee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Forum Hotel for one night when I was on a business trip in Rome. I was immediately struck by how friendly and helpful the staff at reception were, and this continued throughout my stay. This hotel for me is all about location. As a time starved business traveller who rarely gets to see anything other than a view from a taxi and the inside of a hotel room, it was amazing to be able to walk out from the hotel and see so many sights of ancient Rome within a few steps. In the two hours I had to spare before leaving for the airport I was able to see many of the sights on a walking tour. If you only have half an hour to spare you would be able to walk out and see the Coliseum and a few other suitably old things to give you a flavour of the place. The room itself was small, and rather old-fashioned. The TV was tiny with poor reception, and the lighting in the room was rather cold and un-atmospheric. Fortunately I didn't need to do any work - it would have been impossible because there was no suitable desk for working. The breakfast was OK, but nothing special. I was happy because there was some cereal and nice fresh-fruit salad, but I could imagine those with more extravagant breakfast tastes would be disappointed. However, it is on the top floor of the hotel with great views, giving you a nice taster of the city. In summary, a great location to be able to see something, but don't count on being able to work easily in the rooms, and finally really friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, ask for room away from elevators”
Reviews.Author: alm5150
Reviews.Content: Located near the Roman Forum, Colosseum, and Piazza Venezia. Roof top bar offers spectacular views. Breakfast and a welcome drink was included in the rate I had, very good coffee, average selection of breakfast items. Dinner was way overpriced...I had a glass of wine, shrimp and avocado, and pasta with red sauce and bacon. The bill was over 70 EUROs...you pay for the view. I had two stays in the same week. The double bed room was spacious and had good temperature control with a window opening on a central courtyard with the sounds of Rome. I was in a single room that surrounded the elevators for the second part of my stay. The elevators are noisy and slow, guests are noisy, and the window opened right below the kitchen with slamming pots and pans until 1 am. I am not sure if heat was rising from the elevator shaft or from the kitchen, but I was broiling in that room.
