This would have been a perfect stay except for the dinner prices and the terrible room I had during the second stay. Stay away from the elevator abutting rooms and eat in the city...I have trouble saying this...but eating elsewhere in Rome is cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but uncomfortable and unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: scrg06
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on great location and reviews on TripAdvisor. We decided that this would be our "splurge" hotel and paid about $200/night for a double room (not much of a splurge but we paid about $120/night for our rooms in Paris and Venice). The location was indeed fantastic (literally across the street from the Forum and other ruins, a <5-minute walk to the Colosseum (and the Coloseo Metro stop, which was convenient), and a nice central location for many other sights. The view from the rooftop bar/restaurant was lovely, and we enjoyed breakfast there every morning. The room was spacious and the mini-bar was really well stocked with alcohol, beer, Coke/Diet Coke/Sprite, chocolates, nuts, and other fun things that made for good late night snacks. Loved the windows here - they were completely sound and light-proof, so when they were fully closed we were completely cocooned. At one point we took a midday nap and when we woke up at 2 PM we thought we had slept until 2 AM because it was so quiet and dark!! However, the rest of the experience was pretty bad. Our room (404) smelled AWFUL!!! It smelled like sewage or rotting meat. We had to keep the window open when we left to try to air it out, but it didn't help much. We should have complained and switched rooms but we were exhausted when we arrived so we just dealt with it. The bed was probably the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. It was two twin mattresses pushed together, and they seemed to be very old, worn out mattresses. The springs were lumpy and poked up in odd places, and the outside of each mattress was firm, meaning that the middle of the bed was rock hard so we basically had to cram onto one of the twin mattresses. We each got one hard, lumpy pillow. Altogether it was probably the worst sleeping experience I've ever had in a hotel. Luckily we were so exhausted at the end of each day that we slept fine, but we woke up with lots of back and shoulder aches due to the bad bed. The TV was tiny and didn't work very well, which was annoying but not that big of a deal. The internet was completely useless - it was very slow and went down about every five minutes, even though the router was right outside of our room. In all of our European travels, this was the only hotel where we had to pay extra for internet, and it was also the only hotel where the internet was completely unusable. Very frustrating, since my fiance and I both have jobs where we have to have internet access even when on vacation. The decor was dated and spartan, far from impressive. We don't care that much about what our rooms look like, but based on the nice lobby and the outrageous prices at the restaurant we expected more from our rooms. The toilet was crammed into a corner so there was little leg room, and it didn't flush very well. The thermostat did absolutely nothing - we had it on the coldest setting and our room was a sauna when the window was closed. The included breakfast was good but not great. No hot items like eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. Basically just pastries, cereal, and fruit. I do have to admit that the coffee we had there was the closest thing we got to regular old black American coffee in all of Europe, which was nice. The staff was polite and nice but seemed mostly uninterested in us. They spent most of the time crowded around the big-screen TV in the lobby watching soccer/football. We might have had a better experience if we had complained to the management and switched rooms. However, our parents who were there with us switched rooms, and they said both of their rooms were about as bad as ours. All in all, I would avoid this hotel. There are plenty of other hotels in the area that will serve you much better. If you do stay here (or nearby), check out the La Taverna dei Fori Imperiali which is right next door. Best restaurant in Rome! We ate there twice, which we NEVER do when traveling abroad. The matriciana there is FABULOUS as is the chocolate souffle, and the house wine is really really good. They get their ingredients fresh from the market every morning, and you can definitely taste it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice for rome. Staff have no...”
Reviews.Author: lukejohnson
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice for rome. Staff have no idea on how to treat customers or be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Louise740
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, our room was spotlessly clean and we had a decent view too. The location has to be one of the best, most of the sights were within walking distance with the exception of the Vatican though. The roof top bar was a real plus with fantastic views. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Trav300
Reviews.Content: This review is from the perspective of a business traveller who spends more than 100 nights a year in hotels. As Rome is one of my favourite destinations, I was looking forward to my stay in the Forum, especially after reading the reviews on trip advisor. As far as the location is concerned, it's great and the service at the hotel was also fine. However, if you are looking for a luxury first class hotel, as described on their website, you will be disappointed. I have no idea of the grade of room I was given but, it was basic, with a view only of someone else's window although it was qiuet. There is one chair in the twin room and a little TV (with a poor picture) balanced on the minibar which adds to the basic feel, as does the very bright light - it either that, or sit in the dark as there is only one tiny lamp in the twin room. The bed was comfortable and the shower / bath is fine. If you want to use the internet, it costs (€10/day) but is unreliable as the signal drops repeatedly - it was only slightly better in the reception area. I would like to bring my family to Rome for a special break but, unless there is a better standard of room available, I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, nice people, bit old fashioned though.”
Reviews.Author: JN40
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my two children aged 9 and 6. We got 50% off through Expedia. The staff were very welcoming and took us to our room which looked out over a brick wall (but we did get 50% off.) It was super-clean which I really appreciated. I have stayed at hotels where I don't want to take my shoes off! There was no noise from traffic or neighbouring rooms and there were plenty of other guests. The beds were comfortable (not so common in Rome), lovely clean sheets and tons of towels. The three beds were already set up (unlike other hotels we stayed in there). They offered us a free drink at the wonderful bar at the top of the hotel which looks out over the roman ruins and the massive Vittorio Emanuel memorial building. They weren't particularly helpful on recommending a good place to eat with kids, but they did lend us umbrellas and didn't make me feel like the kids were annoying. There weren't any other children at the hotel though. Breakfast was at the top of the hotel so you get an amazing view. Hotel decor was pleasant enough but a bit old fashioned - perhaps that's to be expected considering it's located next to 2000 year old ruins. It's close to everywhere and we pretty much walked all over Rome from here. Thank you Hotel Forum, we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: EandECoDerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September . What a location and the views were unbeatable. Well located to explore all the sites of rome. Staff were excellent and the rooms were top class and well serviced. Have to say also that the service and friendly atmosphere in the rooftop bar at night was brilliant.Well worth a visit . I know I will return

Reviews.Title: “poor hotel, ratings for this hotel are not correct”
Reviews.Author: tourist040
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it recieved great reviews. To my shock, the experience was so bad that I actually changed hotels. I'm all about "when in rome" and have stayed in many different hotels around the world, ie: I know European rooms are small. That said, I don't feel that clients should have to put up with a dirty room (urine on the toilet seat ) and a bathroom that reeked of sewage. I didn't mind that the room was small, it was the fact it was dirty and the decor wasn't vintage, it was just cheap, old and unclean. I never rate hotels online, but felt the need to warn people about the actual room vs. the reviews online. Further the restaurant is very overpriced, an appetizer is nearly 35 USD. I do agree with most folks when they say the location of this hotel is primo, it is, see enclosed view from room window. When I checked in, I was excited about the location and the lobby was charming and clean in appearance; but I was "floored" when I entered my room - I still can't believe I paid $350/night for something compariable to a truckstop hotel room --- but smaller. It is very clear that the management of this hotel needs to sink some of their profits into room improvements and lowering their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Charming! Plus, A Location to Die For”
Reviews.Author: margi0518
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is everything that was described by other travelers. No need for public transportation or taxis - we could walk to all the major attractions. The room was spacious with a window that opened right on to the Forum of Augustus. We could take photos of almost the entire Forum area right from our room. Adored the roof top restaurant and American bar so much we ate there 3 of the 4 evenings. Hotel and Restaurant staff were superb. We noticed that many of the people eating at the restaurant were Italian business people so we presume this was not just another tourist spot. After eating near the hustle-bustle of Piazza Espagna we were happy to return to the relative quiet of the Forum. We would return here in a heart beat - even if the bathroom light bulb was burned out the entire time we were there. It's pure Italy.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay in possibly best tourist location”
Reviews.Author: travelerak53
Reviews.Content: We had double room for 3 nights.Lovely big size, immaculatley clean bathroom(incl shower& bidet).Bedroom also very good big size with more then enough wardrobes ,desk, and TV (BBC &CNN).The cleaning standard one of the best, bedsheets & towels changed daily(clean crisp ultrwhite).Bed very comfortable.Breakfast also very good choice--cereals,fruit.yoghurts,bread also scambled eggs & bacon. The location for the tourist sites probably best--we walked everywhere (except vatican)-area also very good with lots of bars cafes restraunts we also thought very safe area.Altough very expensive the roof top bar is worth one visit for the nighttime views

Reviews.Title: “Truly a World-Class Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FigaroChicago
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Forum is exactly what you would expect from a grand European hotel. The location, overlooking Rome's greatest historic monuments, cannot be surpassed. The decor is elegant and refined, sumptuous and tasteful. The service is impeccable, with the sort of old-world attention to detail and gracious living that makes vacationing here a dream. Our family has stayed at the Hotel Forum for over ten years whenever we are in Rome, and each time we look forward to returning. Our rooms are always beautifully appointed and immaculately clean. The entire staff--from the front desk to the breathtaking rooftop restaurant and American Bar--is outstanding and accommodating in every way. Truly a world-class hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Hotel Forum!”
Reviews.Author: BacktoRome
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 25th anniversary w/ a trip to Rome. A business acquaintance recommended the Hotel Forum (he was born and raised in Rome) as perfect for this milestone occasion. He was right--the room was well appointed and comfortable. We did not have a view of the forums from our room but the terrace more than made up for that. The buffet breakfast was substantial and delicious. Contrary to other comments, our room was cleaned very well each day. The desk staff was helpful. I honestly have nothing but praise for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: addisonite
Reviews.Content: Over all our stay was pleasant here except for most of the staff. They didn't really seem to want to go out of there way for you at all, and in this economy, I'm surprised. The decor was lovely and old fashioned and the breakfast room on the top floor served an abundant breakfast in a beautiful roof-top setting. The location was great for Ancient Rome and the hop-on, hop-off bus made it easy to get a start to everywhere else for us. I think if the staff was not so aloof this hotel would have way better ratings. Overall thoug ,since we are not a real needy bunch, this was a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lisndave
Reviews.Content: I read soooo many reviews on so many hotels before I left and FINALLY it's my turn. This hotel has a great location, is very clean, and we were overall very pleased with our choice. The only thing that could have been a little bit better would have been the front desk people. They were nice, but not overly concerned with helping out. But don't get me wrong, they were not rude to us in any way. It is only a few blocks from the colosseum and across the street from the Forum. Trevi and Pantheon are easily accessible, don't worry about that at all. We stayed at another hotel near Trevi when we came back to Rome (Hotel Fontana) which was just AWFUL. We wished we would've gone back to Hotel Forum. Breakfasts were very nice on the roof top. I would suggest being vigilant if you have dinner there or have drinks in the American Bar (on the rooftop as well) because the prices are just incredible. Italy in general is expensive but these were just out of this world expensive. My wife and I had two drinks at the Bar (a mojito and a caipairina) and it cost 26 Euros which is about 37 American Dollars. We had a room with a view of the Forum (right on the corner above the sign) on the first floor. I think it was a superior room and spent 180 Euros. It was a good value and did get what we paid for it. The room was very spacious, tv was a bit small but it was a flat screen. Good size bathroom and great view from the bathroom window. If you have questions feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “breathtaking view..the hotel less”
Reviews.Author: KatjeBrussels
Reviews.Content: yes yes the view from the terrace is absolutely unforgettable and so will be your breakfasts taken facing Rome's eternity. The hotel itself is just not a four star though. Indeed beds are comfortable and rooms are light, if a bit small. But the finishings are crude (the TV and the minibar looked as old as the forum) and the hygiene was not impeccable. Service is moderately friendly, really depends who is at the reception. The free aperitivo on the terrace for the first night is a nice touch of hospitality. Sot if you get a good rate (I paid about 140€) then go for it because indeed you will hold on to the view for a long time...

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel saved our stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryTravelerSF
Reviews.Content: After seeing lots of room availability at the Inn at the Roman Forum on that hotel's website, we ventured into Rome for two nights after two weeks of travel in Italy - without a hotel reservation (on Sunday, July 5). When we arrived at the Inn, they said they were full for the two nights, except their most expensive room was available for the first night. We turned that down, and went to Hotel Nerva (guided by an old Frommer's book). I won't go into details here, but we wanted out after taking our showers at Nerva. Fortunately, on our way back from dinner, we strolled right by the Hotel Forum, which is just half a block down from the Nerva. It's a 4-star hotel with comparable-level service, very grand (albeit old-syle), and costs just 160-170 euro per night for a sizable room and bathroom that was very nicely appointed. They had availability for our two nights, but we waited until the morning to move in. The hotel is just steps from the Forum, a 20+ minute walk to Campo di Fioro, and a 20 minute walk up Via Corso to the Spanish steps. On the top floor (5th floor) is a very nice restaurant (breakfast was included) with a spectacular view of the forum. My only complaint is that the shower took a couple of minutes before it delivered hot water. We were a bit depressed at the Hotel Nerva. I wish we had approached Nerva from the opposite direction so that we could have had two nights at the Hotel Forum rather than one.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - Ohhhh.. and Charm too !”
Reviews.Author: aseidman
Reviews.Content: This is Old World Rome ! A small botique hotel, with lots of charm and history located across the street from the Roman Forum, a block from the colloseum and near the fasion district of Rome, this place really has it all - it really does not get much better. The rooms are a bit old, but who cares, this is authentic. The service is very nice and the rooftop restaurant is worth the stay alone. Have breakfast there, or a cigar or drink after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BAllison
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel we were in one of the front rooms and the view at night of the forum and the surronding area was unbelieveable. You can walk to many attractions from this hotel. Do not book the last week of May because they have a parade on the 2nd of June and the band is out all night practiceing. The breakfast is great with the dinning room on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “The Ideal Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Mulla2006
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel during what was the only summer we experienced! The hotel has great charm and is well attended by the reception area - they are only too happy to attend to your needs. The rooms are great, and I would recommend that you pay that bit extra for the Deluxe room which overlooks the Roman Forum. There is a rooftop restaurant which is expensive but for that special treat well worth the money - try the apricot flambee! The hotel is mid-way between the Colosseum and the Victor Emmanuel Monument and looks directly over the Roman Forum. All the sights are with easy reach mostly 5 - 25 minutes walk max (the only exception is the Vatican - although you could probably walk it in 40-45 minutes - taxi or Metro). The streets at the back of the hotel have restaurants and there is one square nearby with six restaurants (turn left out of the entrance and walk up the narrow street when you come to a church by a main street, turn left and its there on the right with a fountain) - when its too hot the Romans come out to cool off at night. Musicians travel the square playing to the people in the restaurants. All the while the area is lit up and seeing these monuments at night is great. During the day we used to lunch on pizza or proscuitto and melon washed down by Prosecco!! If you are there for a week take the train to the coast - Stella Polaris - and pay to go into one of the beach areas - it was great to relax and cool off in the clear waters of the Med. We also went up into the hills by train to Tivoli to see the Gardens and it is then a short bus ride to Villa Adriana - well worth it, not many people visit! Take the trains on these trips rather than pay for a guided tour its much cheaper! We saw much more of Rome on foot and a guide book - you have to visit Trajans Forum - you can see it from the road but it is much more spectacular inside! We loved all the sights and everywhere people were very friendly. We hated leaving Roman life and the beautiful Hotel Forum and would definitely go back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, fantastic breakfast, wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: lillytheo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, the rooms are incredibly comfortable and plush. The views from our window were ancient rome, the Imperial forum and Palentine hill. The location could not be better, everything is within walking distance, dining choice's gallore. Breakfast was a full buffet breakfast and delicious. The staff were a little impersonal and the reception bordering on rude, everything else however was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LG23
Reviews.Content: Due to a sudden change in our travel plans, we needed to find accommodation urgently in Rome one Friday afternoon. The Forum was recommended in our guide and so we telephoned asking for a booking. We were offered a really good deal for a double room that was large by Italian standards. It wasn't cheap but represented very good value for money. As others have said, the roof top bar was very beautiful and the bar tender was courteous and gracious. Breakfast, with a superb view over the Forum, was excellent with a wide range of beautiful dishes. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel - Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellerBristol
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the hotel or the staff. No problems with anything. Staff very helpful. Location excellent. Across the road from the Forum and Palatine Hill. 5 mins walk to the Colusseum. An hours stroll to the Vatican and St Peters. Trevi Fountain about 20 mins if that. In fact everywhere we went was walkable, didn't use transport at all. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: gmcosten
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned yesterday from 3 nights in Rome at the Forum. The Forum is exceptionally well situated for the Colosseum, Forum, and Palantine Hills as well as seconds away from a number of basic restaurants, convenience stores, pizza and gelato shops. Every other touristy site in Rome involves a bus/tube ride. All bus/tube connections are close as everything goes by the Colosseum. The lobby/entry is well appointed with dark woods, marble floors and leather furniture. The staff are professional and helpful, if not particularly outgoing or friendly. We had to change rooms upon arrival as the air con was not working properly. The staff had no problem making the change and moving our belongings. The new room was fine, not particularly large or exceptionally well-appointed but clean and comfortable (two twin beds together to make a large bed-not uncommon in the area). There was a large wardrobe for storage. Street noise was there but not a real problem. We of course could hear people wandering up and down the halls but no noise from other rooms or too late at night. The roof top breakfast was quite good we thought-same food each day but decent variety and quality. Unbeatable view. Upon checkout they were happy to store our bags all day as our plane was not leaving until 9:00pm. Final verdict? Not mind-blowing but certainly more than adequate-no major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, LOUD cleaning staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Coastieken
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 9 nights in late June 2008. I was here for work and vacation, and the location was superb for both. I love to walk, and since this hotel is centrally located, I was in heaven. The air conditioning is very good and I stayed in the middle of a significant heat wave. Breakfast is good and the roof-top restaurant is very nice although dinner is significantly overpriced. The bar on the roof is very nice. My only real complaint is the cleaning staff starts very early, near 6AM, and they are very loud and boisterous. This is not so unexpected, although they do enter your room without any knocking or announcement, so its very important to leave out your "do not disturb" sign regardless of the time of day. I was in the shower when the staff walked in unannounced....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: italynewby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Forum in September 2007. We found the hotel to be a clean, wonderfully staffed hotel! This was the first hotel on our 9 day 'trek' across Italy...(3 nights Rome, 1 night Sorrento, 1 night Florence, 1 night Pietro, 2 nights Venice). From the moment we checked in, everyone was so pleasant. From the front desk, bellman, waiters, and bartender! Our room was very spacious (we did reserve their best room though) and bathroom very clean. After a long day of sightseeing, we could have just passed out from exhaustion, but we decided to go to the hotel's rooftop bar, on the fifth floor. I cannot remember the bartender's name, but he was wonderful!! He spoke very good english and was so friendly!! The view from atop the bar was gorgeous, too. You could clearly see the Forum and all the lights from the city were beautiful. The complimentary breakfast bar was very good. It had assorted fruits, cereals, meats, juices, and coffee. All in all a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “The worst room I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: travelquick
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated opposite the main archeological sites, which is an advantage only for the access thereto, while it is quite far from the main shopping areas, like the Spanish steps. The street is narrow and the nearby neighborhood not fantastic. Regarding the hotel itself, it seems it has different types of rooms, but I only saw what they call a "single room". It is the worst (unbelievably worst) room I've ever stayed in. A tiny room measuring hardly 1.80X2.10 meters (that is, the size of a large double bed!), containing one tiny single bed (suitable only for a 7-year-old child), a folding tiny table and a small bathroom with shower only (all equipment in the bathroom was of tiny size, a relatively tall person would have a problem). All furniture was old and worn and, what was awful, was a terrible smell, probably coming out of the bathroom. The room had no view at all, the old window looked out on a side of the building closed around (completely dark in morning also) and permeating all noises from there -- the worst being noise of water coming down from tubes, which kept me awake most of the night. There was no mini bar in the room, obviously because there was no space for that. The noises from the floor corridor were also heard perfectly loudly inside the room. The hotel claimed it is their single standard room, a "standard" that is astonishingly irrelevant to the 4-star level that they claim they have! If I had known, I would have booked another hotel or room for the rate of 170 euros that they charged. Their breakfast was Ok, not much variety but a little of everything. Their front desk service was quite poor with no clear or standard policy on charges -- I heard many people complaining, including most of my business group. I would never stay in that hotel again, I cannot believe it claims it is 4-star!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable opulence”
Reviews.Author: Critix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our wedding night here. We paid a lot for our room but it looked out onto the Forum and had two bathrooms. The hotel kindly provided some complimentary champagne. There's not a lot to say about this hotel other than that it was a superb experience all round for us. The location is incomparable. We only spent one night there and had breakfast the next day, which was plentiful and thorough. It's not the sort of place I would stay at normally because it is quite expensive but you get what you pay for so if you have the money I would definitely recommend this place for luxury and style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location.”
Reviews.Author: MaineWorldtraveler
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Forum in early March. Our room was very clean and quiet. We were on the 2nd floor right over the front door, but were not bothered by noise. The service was excellent and the staff friendly and helpful. They took very good care of us. Breakfast every morning was much appreciated. The room was small, but that's to be expected in Europe. We enjoyed the rooftop restaurant where we had breakfast each morning. We ate there just one night, but didn't have a large meal. Did think the prices were high. Would highly recommend the hotel. The location was great - we were within walking distance of pretty much everything we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Best views in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tjeep
Reviews.Content: This is a romantic boutique hotel in a fantastic location in Rome overlooking archeological ruins. The best thing about the hotel, aside from its location, is the rooftop dining area where breakfast is served, and drinks are available in the evening. Guests checking in get a free drink coupon for a drink on the roof, and should definitely cash in their coupon. I have stayed in this hotel several times, and keep coming back for the roottop restaurant and its breathtaking views of Rome. The rooms are small, but adequate. I don't know if the furnishings are antiques or simply outdated, but I find the overall effect charming, as if from a different decade or even century. Some rooms look out over the ruins, and others don't, so ask for a room with a view. I particuarly recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway holiday in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: bluboySydney
Reviews.Content: forget anything to the you read regarding this hotel, it is truly superb, typical Italian in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for Money”
Reviews.Author: LondonJoey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Opodo for 4 nights. It cost us top dollar but it was way below what one would expect for an allegedly 4 star hotel. Other than the location at the heart of the Forum, it had no other redeeming feature given the rates they charged. (Either way, it was easy to walk about in Rome, so any centrally located hotel would have been as good). The original room was pokey and faced a wall - we were moved then to a marginally better room facing the road. The communal areas were dark and gloomy, the breakfast was very poor. The rest of our group stayed at the Hotel Quirinale on via Nazionale which was also classed 4* but was no comparison (much better, to say the least!) We were thoroughly disappointed and will never recommend this to anyone. It would have just made it as a bottom draw B&B standard in UK.......

Reviews.Title: “room with a view”
Reviews.Author: NonaG
Reviews.Content: Be sure to request a room with a view on an upper floor - it costs a bit more but is worth it. Breakfast is served in the rooftop restaurant. The clear plastic drops are in place during cool weather but the food and service are very good. The restaurant wasn't open for cocktails and the small service bar in the lobby wouldn't honor our "welcome" drink chits. One of our reasons for staying at The Forum was because they advertised a rental car service at the hotel (and confirmed it in an e-mail) - this is not true. We had to take a taxi to the railroad station to make arrangements and then walk three blocks to the garage! As a matter of fact, we had to take taxis everywhere as the hotel, although beautifully situated for ruins viewing, is a little out of the way for many of Rome's wonderful attractions.

Reviews.Title: “It made our trip to Rome an unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: Caesar49
Reviews.Content: Could not be better. It made our visit to Rome an unforgettable experience for all four of us (we traveled with our two twelve years old daughters). The timing was perfect, the reception was great and they had what we requested ( two rooms next to each other). We had a beautiful room looking at the Roman Forum , maybe a little to small but very sophisticated and clean. Breakfast was up to our expectation, and the two dinners we had were not only top cuisine but with a view that was worth a trip to Rome. People were helpful in trying to find solution to our needs. We will definitely go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Hotel Forum”
Reviews.Author: bids2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Forum (via tor di conti) in September 2006. The hotel was 'old fashoned' in a classy way. The staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and the bed linen was changed every morning! The views of the forum from the hotel restuarant are magnificent and the roof terrace bar is a wonderful place to have a drink as the sun sets. We loved the convenience of this hotels proximity to the ruins of ancient Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A location worth paying for?”
Reviews.Author: rhysuk
Reviews.Content: Following reviews on this site, we decided the Hotel forum provided the best balance of price and location. When we arrived there was a mix up with our reservation (partly our fault) but it was quickly settled. Our room was small but clean and although we had a view of an alley we didn't mind as it made us feel a little more Roman!! The real 'wow' factor of this hotel is the restaurant on the roof, on a warm spring morning they take the covers off and you can eat breakfast while looking over the forum, onto palentine hill and with the Coliseum just down the road. Breathtaking. The location allowed us to walk all over Rome, (there a are a number of homeless people near the hotel which can be off putting) without having to pay for a taxi (getting fleeced on the way in from the airport put us off these guys anyway). We ate in the restaurant one night and although extremely expensive, the service was good. The staff generally were stuffy, very old fashioned and were very male dominated (my girlfriend thinks this is why they can be perceived as arrogant) although they were polite and helpful in almost all circumstances (and I loved being served a beer by a guy in a penguin suit at 2pm on a tuesday afternoon). This place is not going to be your best hotel ever but Rome is an expensive place and for the location, we thought it was worth it (although others may not).

Reviews.Title: “awful, had to move out!”
Reviews.Author: dylanmax
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Rome in the last year and we thought we would stay a bit nearer the centre of the city. The Forum is not a four star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. We were given a room on the fourth floor, which we thought would be good because of the view over the forum site. Unfortunately the air conditioning didn't work, and this necessitated the windows being left open at night. The street noise and bar opposite made sleeping difficult. The room was cramped, the breakfast very sub-standard. The second night we were awoken at midnight by staff scraping tables across the restaurant floor until the early hours of the morning, despite several complaints to the hotel desk. We arranged to move hotel and the final straw was the presence of a large number of homeless people outside the hotel who used the area as a toilet and dosshouse, we saw several rats running around. Do yourselves a favour, look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an old lady”
Reviews.Author: tomdelux
Reviews.Content: I loved the Forum and found the staff surprisingly helpful during our two day stay. The location and views cannot be beat; yes, you are paying for it. When they say single room here, they really mean single room --a very small room with just a twin bed. When couples are traveling together you must specifically request a room for two people--we had a queen size bed in a rather small room and found it adequate. The breakfast buffet included hot items and was simply spectacular on the roof top with all of ancient rome below and beyond. Great rooftop bar too--fortunately all of our drinks were complimentary. I loved the hotel and all its quirkiness--this is a dowager that is worth visiting and taking advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlgtravel
Reviews.Content: We came in on a Sunday and what a time. The main road was closed for car traffic right across from the hotel. We were able to wander the area with the locals. The breakfast was wonderful-what a view. It was a wonderful location, attentive staff and clean and comfortable. The rooms are well appointed and it is so close to the action! Thank you Hotel Forum for all of your help with our site seeing! We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Warning Warning Will Rogers”
Reviews.Author: hairy-bacon
Reviews.Content: i am sitting in my new hotel here in Rome: Art Hotel. had to leave the hotel forum after two terrible nights of non-sleep on two twin beds that were pushed together with a huge lump down the middle. the pillows were like potatoe sacks. just awful! we had requested a room with a view, which we got, but the noise from the intersection is like being over a freeway. also, watch out on the rooftop bar: i ordered a rum and coke. the bill came and they charged me $10 for the rum and $6 for the coke! 16 euro rum and coke: ouch. do your self a favor and stay away from this place. it is waaaay over priced... even with the location and view.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: anotherglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I was booked to stay in the hotel for a week but moved into another hotel after just one day. Hotel Forum Rome is the least value for money, and one of the most uncomfortable hotels I have stayed in, and I have stayed in many as I have a job with high travel. The rooms are tiny. The closets which have sliding doors are so small that once you hang a jacket or a shirt the sliding door cannot be closed unless with the other hand you ensure that the jacket is turned at an angle. The shower throws water across the width of the narrow tub (instead of the length as in most other hotels) so you keep on banging the wall or the smelly shower curtains. The sound-proofing in the rooms does not exist. I find it difficult to sleep in noise and was therefore miserable as the hotel is bang next to main and busy streets. I was promised that there is wireless internet (not free) in the rooms. This turned out to be untrue and I had to access the internet in the hotel lobby (after paying for it), and could see most other guests doing the same. They promise 24 hrs room service but cannot provide a cup of coffee early in the morning. I was told by their staff that if I want champagne it can be provided at any time, but coffee/tea requires a person to make and they do not have people for it (why they cannot provide an electric coffee maker in the room beats me). Breakfast in the restaurant starts at 7AM. I reached there at 7:15 and asked for an omelette. Was told that the person who makes the omelette comes at 8AM (can't understand why he/she cannot be asked to come in at 7AM as the placed was packed with guests at 7:15). The staff in the front desk is rude. However the restaurant and housekeeping staff was polite. Now on the positives. Excellent location i.e right in the heart of the city - so saves you the commute (however the other hotel I stayed in provided free and frequent shuttle service to city centre. This I understand is true of most other good hotels as well). The other positive is the view from the roof-top restaurant. All in all a terrible experience. I have no intention of returning ever to Hotel Forum in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: linadal
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in July, 2006. Our room overlooked the ruins of the forum. That was great. The hotel was very clean. The rooms were big and the bathrooms were big. It was a very elegant hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant and bar were on the roof overlooking a monument and the ruins of the Forum. It was an awesome sight at night. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hate this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They advertise lower rates opn the internet than they actually chrge when you arrive. The place is noisy, the staff is supercilious and cocky. I would prefer staying on the streets bacuse for the price you pay and the nosies you hear, you would feel the differnce except in your wallet. Go elsewhere !

Reviews.Title: “A hotel which is too expensive to what it delivers”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Gustafsson
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forum is not that bad actually. If you are happy with coming home to grand ma you will feel at home. It looks and feels very of the 60's. It is clean but it is pretty expensive, which is hard to understand because it feels like they haven't invested in any furniture, beds and carpets the last 30 years. The Skybar is nice and the elderly man working the bar is fantastic! The roof-top restaurant has a staff that I don't know where they were found, they shouldn't wait on people anyway. Beware of the BUFFÉ, the headwaiter wanted to charge us by the plate because he saw the buffé as a starter to the rest of the dinner, we didn't!!! The consierge and the front desk, gives you the kind of service they have to but with no enthusiasm or heart at all. We had a room with a pretty view, but that was it. Hotels in Rome is a tricky thing but since they have all the tourists all the time they don't really care about your treatment, there will always come a new guest the following day. Peter G

Reviews.Title: “The view is great, the food is terrible but expensive, staff is arrogant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon in Rome. Luckily we stayed at a different hotel (Hotel Hossianum Palace near Venezian Plaza). Hotel Forum looked great on the internet, so we decided when walking by it, to have dinner at their marvelous - the Forum Romanun and Rome overlooking - Terrace Restaurant. When first walking in, we thought what a great Hotel and what a beautiful restaurant. The atmosphere is really great. Unfortuanately the Food was terrible (and we've eaten at a lot of places) and the staff was not efficen t( even though there were about 5 waiters for each table) and arrogant. Our advise: Take in the view but don't expect any good food or servcie. There were no locals in this restaurant and tables were empty: a good indicator for the quality of the restaurant! For the rooms we can't say anything, since we stayed somewhere else...which was a charming hotel in the middle of downtown Rome but still quiet. But see my review for Hotel Hossianum Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dave_das
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of April 2006. The reception, concierge and bar staff were very helpful and friendly. The room, although not big, was elegant and comfortable. We had a room at the front with a wonderful view overlooking the forum and, yes, it was noisy: impossible to sleep at night without the window closed; but what do you expect in the middle of a busy city? When you tire of atmosphere, close the windows and shutters and turn up the air conditioning. The rooftop restaurant is worth a visit for dinner, although you get to go there everyday for breakfast. It is overpriced, the food's not that great and some of the waiters think quite a lot of themselves, but taking into account the wonderful setting, I wasn't disappointed. It's a pity, though, that you can't just go there in the evening for a drink; this is actively discouraged, even for residents. I can't understand why as it's described as Rooftop Restaurant and American Bar. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay here, right in the centre within easy walking distance of a lot of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: dgb
Reviews.Content: Spend the extra 100 Euro and stay elsewhere, while the location is good and the views from the restaurant will sell you, the staff (part. the restaurant) difficult. It was difficult to get a drink etc. The rooms are small even by Roman standards (however the double connecting rooms and baths are fine) the singles dank and the our bathroom smelled of urine the entire visit. My husband is European and we have lived in Europe for a number of years and I based my selection of this hotel on the reviews here. Again, if this is your budget, then fine, but if you could afford a bit more SPEND IT!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Forum”
Reviews.Author: sazamataz
Reviews.Content: We went to the Forum over Easter having been transfered there from the horrific first hotel we went to. It is a charming old fashioned hotel with lots of character. Old wood, antique furniture and glass. Clean, comfortable rooms if a liitle worn here and there but the best thing about the hotel is it's location right opposite the ruins of the Forum and near the Colosseum.The roof terrace where you have breakfast has a fantastic panoramic view and it has a roof garden bar to have drink in the afternoon or evening and watch the sun go down over Rome...wonderful. We walked everywhere which is the best way to see Rome as the taxis rip you off and public transport isn't easy. The staff were very helpful and friendly and we enjoyed our stay here very much

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view but that is all”
Reviews.Author: seachange88
Reviews.Content: I took my 11 year old daughter on a trip to Italy with the final leg being in Rome. I had never come across such rude, inefficient and arrogant staff in all my life!!! On arrival they claimed we had no reservations and only "found" or room once I showed them Emails of my reservation from the Hotel Manager.The room was noisy and poorly cleaned. When I asked if it were possible to have a quieter room, the carry on by the front desk staff was unbelievable. Unknown to them I speak and understand Italian being of Italian parents so I was not impressed with the language and attitude that we were just tourists and would not be back so it didn't matter anyway!! Luckily this hotel is not a representative of the attitude we had encountered at other hotels and people in Italy. They claim to boast a 4/5 star rating..more like a minus 1 star!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor sound proofing ... felt my bed was in pub next door!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Forum hotel. All review will agree that location is perfect and the restaurant view over the Forum is perfect .... that is very true ... but ... but, but!!! Rooms are fair, maybe a little too small but who really care about that. Breakfast is nothing special. Worst issues are: Window sound proofing is terrible. One can hear the street and the next door pub (people signing, shouting) for part of the night. This is true for most room on the Coliseum side of the hotel. Worse, it would be time for hotel management to refresh the mattress ... beds are not confortable. In summary, could not sleep much during my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Forum Fabulous View!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: what a fabulous view from the Hotel's roof top restaurant... you can see Piazza Venezia (the white wedding cake monument which dominates the city center of Rome) We booked directly with the hotel using their own online booking system (they guarantee the best available rate if you book online) and were treated like VIPs... every evening the hotel housekeeping staff came in and turned down our bed covers, in the morning the maitre remembered if we wanted cappucino or caffe americano and the bar man at the American bar was charming. Our room wasn't the biggest and wasn't as nice as the rooms depicted on the web site however, it was clean and comfortable. I recommend dining in the roof top restaurant just the once as it is definitely worth it even if a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Wedding Reception”
Reviews.Author: shellyLLLL
Reviews.Content: I held my wedding reception here for 40 guests, on the rooftop terrace. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. The staff are excellent and cannot do enough to help. The food is to die for, the wedding cake magical and the overall ambience is fantastic. I can't wait to go back! The caviar nibbles were lovely and the wine flowed late into the night. TEN OUT OF TEN.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel For Families With Teens”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Forum Hotel for a week in mid-August 2005. Our choice was based on Trip Advisor comments. We arrived around noon tired and sweaty and were taken immediately to our clean, air conditioned room. Our party was two adults and our 14-year old son. A triple room consisted of separate bedrooms (small by American standards but ample by European stds) and a fairly large luxury bathroom. We had a mini refrigerator packed with expensive treats - we moved them aside and moved in our water bottles; and they were great to return to at the end of a day sight-seeing. Our room was on the 2nd floor (3rd floor actually) and in the back. In mid-August the hotel was only half full and quiet, but fully staffed - very nice! We loved starting the day with the excellent buffet breakfast on the beautiful rooftop restaurant. Behind and above that is a rooftop bar which is wonderful on summer nights. Staff was professional in that European way - we liked them. They were all eager to please if you took time to notice. The location is really good, especially for young teens whom you want to explore the Forum, Coliseum, Capitol Hill, etc. Good walkers can easily walk to Piazza Nuvona and the Pantheon. For other locations, the subway station is only 7-8 minutes walk from this hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Frozenrose
Reviews.Content: Let's just say...the location can not be better if you are there to walk and see the sites!! Literally 10 feet from the Forum Augustus. We could have thrown a rock from our window into the Forum. Be sure to ask for a room with a view. We had a nice, large room, and large bathroom. We were very pleased with our room. The television only has Italian with no english BBC World or CNN world which would have been nice but we were learning some italian watching the dubbed Jag and such..LOL. The lobby is warm and inviting and the concierge/ front desk staff were very helpful to us. I would say my only negative was the staff in the rooftop restaurant during the week. The weekend staff was nice but the weekday staff was not so pleasant. Somewhat primadonnaish. The buffet breakfast was adequate to get us started on the day. The view from the rooftop terrace was excellent. What we appreciated was the location!!! Five minute walk to the Colloseum, Forums, Palentine, Nero's Golden House etc. Just two minutes up to the Vittorio Emmanual Monument, Trajan's Market, Forum of Caesar etc. Could not ask for a better location for walkers such as us. Restaurants in the area were okay, not fantastic but passable, we generally ate much further from the hotel but it was a perfect spot to complete morning tours, wander about and take a quick break before moving on for the afternoon and evening.

Reviews.Title: “What a location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last night we had the best view in town from the rooftop of the Hotel Forum in Rome. We dined with a refreshing breeze as the sun set over the ancient ruins. As darkness blanketted us, the buildings were inspiring with their individual lighting and the birds hovered overhead with their wings catching the strong beams of light. Being up so high it would have been nice to have a light jacket for the shoulders. The food was good, the company pleasant, the sites fantastic. How blessed we were to be enjoying this treat!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: JSurace
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the Hotel Forum in Rome. After reading some of the recent middling reviews and knowing hotels in Rome in general, I was prepared for some possible disappointment. However, the Hotel Forum was exactly what I had hoped for. For someone with an interest in antiquities, the location could not be better. You are literally on top of one of the Roman forums, and a short walk from the Forum, the Colosseum, the Palatine, etc. Being near the Colosseum, the hotel is also just a few blocks from its associated metro stop. The building is centuries old and part of a church (the bells ring each morning), so there's no fancy stuff like a purpose-built hotel. That is, no recreation facilities, pool, etc. I didn't expect them, so I didn't miss them. Yes, the room was small, and in America for this price would have been a multi-room suite with hot tub. Here, we got a clean room, with a queen-sized bed, a wooden floor, rugs, period furniture, venetian glass lights, and a (small) well-updated bathroom done in marble with a tub and shower, all in excellent condition. The room had decent closet space, a phone (never used), and a wall safe. In fact, the entire hotel was well-appointed and in excellent condition. There is a (really small, think phone booth) elevator, although we generally used the stairs. The rooftop restaurant was terrific for morning breakfast before hiking through the ruins. Oh, and the rooms are air-conditioned. We used the restaurant once for dinner. The multi-course meals were quite good, but I will agree that it was overpriced for what could have been had elsewhere in town. Some people have complained about the lack of eating places nearby. Technically that is true - the forum area has few restaurants beyond some not terrific cafe type places next door. However, a 15-minute walk over to the vicinity of the Trevi Fountain/Pantheon area will take you to about a million little restaurants all of which are pretty tourist friendly. And in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, particularly during the day, there are loads of cart vendors and such selling pizza, gelato, etc. which are really quite good for a lunch in front of the Colosseum. Our room was near the back of the hotel. Our balcony window looked out over a small alley, but had a clear view of the forum to the right. Most of the rooms are like this. The hotel itself is rectangular, with the narrow side directly facing the forum, and the long side overlooking the alley. From looking at the floor plan, it looked as though there are a handful of rooms with potentially no view. Yes, the rooms are noisy, mostly from traffic noise, but it is Rome. Bring earplugs. The balcony doors look like they have been recently updated with airtight doors, so if you seal them at night they cut down on the noise a lot. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Forum”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Rome and had an AMAZING experience at the Hotel Forum. We arrived in our room to find a chilled bottle of champagne welcoming us to Rome. We had a corner room on the second floor (room 202, I believe) with a spectacular view of the Forum grounds. How many places can you wake up in your bed and look out the window at some of the ancient ruins of Rome. Needless to say, the location of the Hotel Forum is superb. Most major sites are within walking distance. Although some others on this website have mentioned that their rooms were small, ours was quite spacious and had a very nice bathroom (also with a window overlooking the ruins). We found the staff very helpful and responsive to our requests. They even set us up with one of the best private tour guides we have ever met (her name is Luisa). We stayed at the Hotel Forum for four nights and will definitely stay there again if/when we return to Rome.
